newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson, Viasystem sign letter of intent.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson, Viasystem sign letter of intent.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson said on Wednesday it signed a letter of intent with U.S. Viasystem Group about the possibility of the U.S. group acquiring its printed circuit board plant in Sweden.
"A final agreement is expected later this year," Ericsson said in a statement.
The plan is part of Ericsson's intention to focus on core businesses, it said.

Printed board operations at Norrkoping in Sweden employ about 350 people. The unit's output includes the production of printed circuit boards which are used in most of Ericsson's products, Ericsson said.
Viasystems Group Inc is the second largest independent manufacturer of printed circuit boards and backpanels in the world, the statement said.
